"Collapse" by Jared Diamond is a fascinating book that explores the complex relationships between environmental factors, societal choices, and the fate of ancient civilizations. It's a thought-provoking read that can help you understand the long-term consequences of human activities on the environment.

"The Maya and the Environment" by Peter N. Peregrine is a great choice if you're interested in delving deeper into the environmental history of the Maya civilization. It's a more specialized book that can provide valuable insights into the sustainable practices and environmental challenges faced by the Maya people.

Remember, these books can provide a more in-depth understanding of the topics you're interested in, and can complement the documentaries and articles you've been reading.

If you have any more questions or need further recommendations, feel free to ask!
